intro: Luntia sericea, commonly known as the silky lontar, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces white or pale yellow flowers that are often fragrant, attracting various pollinators. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in a fine, silky hair, giving it its common name. Luntia sericea is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along riverbanks.
